annotations.description: Summary. Policy makers are increasingly seeking to develop overall measures of the effi-ciency of public service organizations. For that, the use of ‘off-t
annotations.title: Measuring the Efficiency of Public Services: The Limits of Analysis
The use of Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) in healthcare with a focus on hospitals | Health Care Management Science
Data Envelopment Analysis: A Comprehensive Text with Models, Applications, References and DEA-Solver Software | SpringerLink

annotations.description: Produces LaTeX code, HTML/CSS code and ASCII text for well-formatted tables that hold regression analysis results from several models side-by-side, as well as summary statistics.
annotations.title: stargazer: Well-Formatted Regression and Summary Statistics Tables

textContent:
Intro:
Metodología:
- Manual para DEA (libro gordo, quiza no incluir)  https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/b109347
- Limitaciones. https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10729-018-9436-8#Sec8: For example, slacks are not included in the efficiency score, or weights of zero can be applied to all but one input (the same is true for outputs). This means that each DMU can exclude important characteristics from the analysis. This fact has been criticized by Dyson et al. [98], among others. It stands to reason that the model developments of the past decades have been adapted too sparsely. This may be one of the reasons why DEA benchmarking is still a theoretical framework and is hardly used by managers or governments, as explained in section 6.
To increase the chance of applying the most appropriate model, the choice for constant or variable returns to scale should not be done by assumption, but by the support of statistical tests as provided by Banker [27] and Simar & Wilson [311]. Additionally, the data sample size should be considered. Banker et al. [29] show that the CCR model yields better results for small sample sizes with up to 50 DMUs, while the BCC model performs better with larger sample sizes (at least 100 DMUs). 
- Mas limitaciones: https://academic.oup.com/jrsssa/article/168/2/401/7084294?login=false
- 
- 
Resultados:
Discusión:
Conclusión: 
Notas:
Modelo DEA utilizado es:
- The BCC is named after Banker, Charnes, and Cooper and includes variable returns to scale (VRS)
- Mapas: https://eurogeographics.org/maps-for-europe/
- Visualizacion latex linreg stargazer: Hlavac, Marek (2022). stargazer: Well-Formatted Regression and Summary Statistics Tables.

title: bibliografía
textContentHtml:
Intro:

Metodología:

- Manual para DEA (libro gordo, quiza no incluir)  https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/b109347

- Limitaciones. https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10729-018-9436-8#Sec8: For example, slacks are not included in the efficiency score, or weights of zero can be applied to all but one input (the same is true for outputs). This means that each DMU can exclude important characteristics from the analysis. This fact has been criticized by Dyson et al. [98], among others. It stands to reason that the model developments of the past decades have been adapted too sparsely. This may be one of the reasons why DEA benchmarking is still a theoretical framework and is hardly used by managers or governments, as explained in section 6.

To increase the chance of applying the most appropriate model, the choice for constant or variable returns to scale should not be done by assumption, but by the support of statistical tests as provided by Banker [27] and Simar & Wilson [311]. Additionally, the data sample size should be considered. Banker et al. [29] show that the CCR model yields better results for small sample sizes with up to 50 DMUs, while the BCC model performs better with larger sample sizes (at least 100 DMUs). 

- Mas limitaciones: https://academic.oup.com/jrsssa/article/168/2/401/7084294?login=false

- 

- 

Resultados:

Discusión:

Conclusión: 

Notas:

Modelo DEA utilizado es:

- The BCC is named after Banker, Charnes, and Cooper and includes variable returns to scale (VRS)

- Mapas: https://eurogeographics.org/maps-for-europe/

- Visualizacion latex linreg stargazer: Hlavac, Marek (2022). stargazer: Well-Formatted Regression and Summary Statistics Tables.

 R package version 5.2.3. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=stargazer
